3:
Put your sword on your side, mighty one,\q in your glory and your majesty.
\q
6:
Your throne, God, is forever and ever;\q a scepter of justice is the scepter of your kingdom.
\q
7:
You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness;\q therefore God, your God, has anointed you
\q with the oil of gladness more than your companions.


\q
9:
Kings' daughters are among your honorable women;\q at your right hand stands the queen clothed in gold of Ophir.


\q
10:
Listen, daughter, consider and incline your ear;\q forget your own people and your father's house.
\q
11:
In this way the king will desire your beauty;\q he is your master; revere him.


\q
12:
The daughter of Tyre will be there with a gift;\q the rich among the people will beg for your favor.
\q
13:
The royal daughter in the palace is all glorious;\q her clothing is worked with gold.


\q
14:
She will be led to the king in embroidered dress;\q the virgins, her companions who follow her,
\q will be brought to you.
\q
15:
They will be led by gladness and rejoicing;\q they will enter into the king's palace.


\q
16:
In the place of your fathers will be your children,\q whom you will make princes in all the earth.
\q
17: I will make your name to be remembered in all generations;\q therefore the peoples will give you thanks forever and ever.
